_header: Saint Botolph the holy monk and eke his brother
Subjects: saints’ lives; Botolph, saint, life of
_description: Life of St. Botolph in the South English Legendary — couplets

Bod779.First Lines:
Seint botolf þe holy monk & ek his broþerbore were in
                    ingelond as is many an oþer…
Bod779.Last Lines:
…Nowȝ god for seynt botolf is loue soch grace vs
                    sendeþat we to þilke ioyȝe come & so þe deuil
                    schende

BodEngPoeta1.First Lines:
Seint Botulf þis holy Monk and Adulf his broþerI bore
                    weore in Engelonde as was moni anoþer…
BodEngPoeta1.Last Lines:
…Now God for þe loue of him his grace þou vs
                    sendeÞat we mote to þat Ioye come and so þe Deueles schende
                    Amen.
BodEngPoeta1.Facsimiles:
Doyle,  I. A.,
                        ed.  
             The Vernon Manuscript. A Facsimile of Bodleian Library, Oxford, MS Eng.
                poet.a.1,
          with an introduction by A. I. Doyle. Cambridge: D. S. Brewer, 1987. 
Scase,  Wendy,  and  Nick Kennedy, eds.  
             A facsimile edition of the Vernon manuscript: Oxford, Bodleian Library, MS. Eng. Poet. A. 1.
         Oxford: The Bodleian Library, 2011.

CamTCC605.First Lines:
SEint botolf þe holy monke & adulf his broþerWere
                    bore in englonde as is many an oþer…
CamTCC605.Last Lines:
…& þer in oure lordes seruyse his lyf he broȝt to
                    endeNow god for þe loue of hym his swete grace ous sende

BLEge1993.Last Lines: …Now god for þe loue of him his swete grace vs sendeÞat we mote to þe ioie come & so þe deueles schende
